Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: the_crazy_traveller
Reviews.Content: this is a very small and budget lodge with only 9 rooms. IF you want 5 stars conf or deluxe services, this is not the place for you, just go next door and pay 3 times more. The hotel offered enought for what we paid (65â‚¬ a night, incl breakfast with omeletes!) . Our room was not the biggest, but clean and confortable for our needs. We indeed spent more time on the wonderful terraces and walking around, so after all a real good choice. The hotel is in a quite location, in the middle of the old city, just a short stroll from the Bue Moschee, Aiga Sophia and the Cistern Basilic. What can you ask more for this money :-)) The night porter (James Bond), the receptionist (Tom Cruise) and the waiter in charge for breakfast were very helpful and always tryied to please our noisy small group of Italians. Definitely, we will go back to Istanbul soon, and definitely go back to Muhlsi Bey. Greetings from the Italians!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leisa B
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, could not have been more helpful.excellent location. Good quiet rooms some are a little small but for the price they are excellent

Reviews.Title: “A view on Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: florentiacivitas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is smal and in a good position to visit the most important attraction of the city. Close by every means of transport and very quiet. The staff was so kind, friendly and always ready to help us...and, what's more important, ever and ever smiling!!! From the big terrace on the roof you can have a 360Â° view. The neighbourhood is definetly safe and is within easy reach. Hope to be back sono.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal”
Reviews.Author: ExpIorer
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel so service and amenities are minimal, but a great deal overall. The location is very good, right on the best spot in old town (just accross the entrace of the Four Seasons) and the views from the rooftop terrace are excellent, you can see the blue mosque and agia Sophia very close to you while you have breakfast in the terrace. We stayed 5 nights and paid 90â‚¬/night for the suite room in the 2nd floor. The other rooms didn't look as nice, so I'd recommend calling them directly to check availability.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist trap to avoid!”
Reviews.Author: caroladittrich
Reviews.Content: The price is definitely excessive for the kind of hotel: the service is nonexistent since there is only one person trying to do everything (and not friendly at all); when we arrived the shower was broken and so it stayed despite we asked several times to fix it. Poor breakfast with bad limited choice. From the room we could hear the other rooms (and vice-versa I suppose) and the noise from the street. The room is basic (no telephone, minibar, â€¦) and during 5 days has been cleaned once; it was also hard to get clean towels. At last, the wireless internet connection that was supposed to be included wasn't even working. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top location -good room”
Reviews.Author: Geoffdm
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a small but very comfortable and well decorated room with small but modern bathroom and balcony looking out onto Four Seasons Hotel and Hagia Sophia. The location could not be better. The room was great overall and the reception staff helped us whenever we needed anything. Breakfast served on roof terrace and was simple but plentiful. Reception and stairs were small and plain but totally in keeping with the type of hotel. Overall a great place to stay in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Cinjim1
Reviews.Content: We were introduced to the Muhlis Bey Hotel by our Turkish friend Fatih Gungor whom we met soon after arriving in Istanbul. He said that it was a small boutique hotel with clean rooms and a great location. We checked it out and found it was a gem that is extremely well located very close to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and the other attractions in the Sultanahmet area. The rooms are small but are tastefully decorated and we found to be very satisfactory. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We will definitly stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: maydaymusic
Reviews.Content: Misleading website. My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights but didn't get what we were told when we made the booking. Good location but not value for price. We paid 80euro per night. The following weekend we spent at the Hotel Sumengan that given us 4 stars standard of living which only cost us 5euro more per night. My husband & I didn't like the service of Muhlis bey hotel. King size bed wasn't the King size bed. It was combined by 2 single beds. When we complained about the hairdryer wasn't worker, they never even bother to fit up. The person at the reception wasn't friendly. Breakfast has very limited choice. No view. Our room suppose to have a panoramic view...but not as they promised. Very Bad Experience. No sound proof among the room. Noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with my partner at the Muhlis Bey for one week and found it a pleasant place and very good value for money. The location is great, in a quiet street in Sultanhamet, opposite to the Four Seasons, and near to the so called backpackerland. The area has a relaxed atmosphere and little traffic, so you don't need to worry about noise (except for that produced occasionally by the staff of the Four Seasons, for example vacuum cleaning the lobby in the middle of the night). You can hear the muezzin singing from a distance in the early morning - not a problem. The hotel is exactly between the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia, so you get great views of both, as well as of the Marmara Sea, from the top floor terrace, which is quite large and nice (but be prepared, the flowers are plastic). The breakfast is ok, served in a covered area of the terrace equipped with a full kitchen. The lobby is extremely small, but there is always someone there for you. The staff is helpful, they reply to emails quickly, assist you with your reservation, and can arrange airport pick up and drop off. The hotel used to be called AliBaba, as you can still notice from details as keyrings, and is a sister hotel of the Apricot. The rooms are clean, with wooden floors, kilims, comfortable beds, tv, good AC, private bathroom, and balcony. We had a small room with a small balcony overlooking the backyard, which was nice, and some days later we decided to upgrade to a bigger room with a view on Haghia Sofia, a little more expensive but still affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but soon to be more expensive”
Reviews.Author: redheadca
Reviews.Content: We couldn't stay at our first choice, the Sebnem, which is right around the corner. Tahir at the Sebnem found us a room at the Ali Baba for 60euro...a reduction from their normal 80ero price. We were in room 9 on the top floor. It looks out at the beautiful Four Seasons Hotel and has its own small balcony. The room was a nice size with a wall full of windows. It had a mini-bar and TV. The bathroom was a nice size and had a shower/tub combination. The only issue we had was actually finding the Ali Baba. We had seen its sign as we left the Sebnem 2 weeks earlier, but when we returned, the sign was down and the first floor had been demolished. The rooms were all intact, however, they were just doing a renovation of the lobby. The Ali Baba is well located within a 5 minute walk of the Blue Bosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Sutanahmet metro stop. Its also only a 10 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar. There are restaurants everywhere in the area...as well as carpet shops. The manager told us that he would be continuing renovations and will soon be raising the rates to 100euro. The whole area seems to be increasing rates and upgrading. I would definitely stay here again at the rate we paid, but I'd look at alternatives at the higher rates since I always travel on a tight budget.
